To rewrite the expression \( rac{|3x + 6|}{x + 2}\) using piecewise notation without absolute value bars, we first use the definition of absolute value:

\[ |3x + 6| $$=$$
 egin{cases}
$$3x$$ + $$6$$ & 	ext{if } $$3x$$ + $$6$$ \geq $$0$$ \
-(3x + 6) & 	ext{if } $$3x$$ + $$6$$ < $$0$$
\end{cases} \]

Let's solve for when \(3x + $$6$$ $$=$$ 0\):
\[ $$3x$$ + $$6$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ \]
\[ $$3x$$ $$=$$ $$-6$$ \]
\[ $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-2$$ \]

Now, we use this information to express the original function as two cases:

$$1$$. **Case when \(x \geq -2\):** Here, \(3x + $$6$$ \geq 0\), so \(|3x + 6| $$=$$ $$3x$$ + 6\).
\[  rac{|3x + 6|}{x + 2} $$=$$  rac{3x + 6}{x + 2} $$=$$ $$3$$ \]
(When \(x > -2\), because division by zero is undefined at \(x $$=$$ -2\).)

$$2$$. **Case when \(x < -2\):** Here, \(3x + $$6$$ < 0\), so \(|3x + 6| $$=$$ -(3x + 6)\).
\[  rac{|3x + 6|}{x + 2} $$=$$  rac{-(3x + 6)}{x + 2} $$=$$ $$ rac{-3x$$ - 6}{x + 2} $$=$$ $$-3$$ \]

Hence, the piecewise notation for the expression is:

\[
 rac{|3x + 6|}{x + 2} $$=$$
 egin{cases}
$$3$$ & 	ext{if } $$x$$ > $$-2$$ \
$$-3$$ & 	ext{if } $$x$$ < $$-2$$
\end{cases}
\]

This corresponds to the option: "3 if \(x > -2\) and $$-3$$ if \(x < -2\)".
